newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks set new life high in early trading.
newsitem.headline: French stocks set new life high in early trading.

text.p: The French stockmarket's blue chip CAC-40 index set a new life high of 2,365.51 points on Monday at 0910 GMT, surpassing the previous record of 2,360.98 set in February 1994.
The index was up 1.6 percent in early trading after Wall Street set a fresh closing record on Friday.

"The bourse is swept up by Wall Street, by the bond markets and by expectations of higher corporate results in France for 1997," said Jean-Pierre Filbien, director of sales at Deutsche Morgan Grenfell in Paris.
The French stockmarket had been lagging other bourses, which broke one record after another last year.
Wall Street's Dow Jones industrial average set its fourth closing record for the week on Friday after rising 78 points to close above 6,700 points.
The CAC-40 January futures contract was 35 points higher at 2,366.
